Tasted on 24.12.16. Pleasant fruity and citrus aroma, a bit herbal. ItÂ’s probably birch juice. Small head disappearing to thin layer. Hazy dirty yellow colour. Fruity sweetness and herbs in taste. Very unusual and intriguing. Great.

podobno pol tej butelki to sok z brzozy / they say half of it is a pure birtch / drugie pol to pszenica / second half is pszenica / mimo to kupilem / nevertheless I bought it / i nie zaluje warto bylob/ wonÂ’t regret it!

#1059Bottle. Hazy yellow body, small white head. Great aroma of birch wine, honey, nuts, turkish honey, wheat and some fruits, maybe citruses, too. Taste is neutral with tones of malty sweetness. Birch, yeast, wheat, citruses. Light body, low carbonation. Very interesting! Tasty.

Very very light straw beer with low head.
Banana and other fruits in aroma. It really smells like a birch tree juice (I know cause I drink it from time to time, itÂ’s very healthy). ThereÂ’s also some citrus hints and some soap.
The beer is not bitter at all. ItÂ’s sweet and a bit sour. ItÂ’s refreshing.
Light body, kinda dry in mouth.

Succesfull experiment. Vividly hoppy in aroma. ThereÂ’s very clear, vivid and pleasant hoppy note from centennial in aroma. Very light, refreshing, drinkable, quite sour in taste with poor bitterness. I think the bitternes is too low for beer geeks (IBU 20). Finish is too sour with almost no bitterness, nevertheless the taste is nice, definately more sour then bitter with clear hoppy notes and notes of birch juice. Appearance is very good, with small but nice head. ItÂ’s regularly cloudy. As a beer-like drink it deserves 10/10. As a beer I give 15/20 overall note.
Exceptional taste, something you really dont expect from that low alcoholic "summer" beer. The taste is very rich and satisfying.

Bottle @ home, from hats-off, gdansk. Pours a cloudy yellow liquid with a small, quickly dissipating white head and no lacing. Aroma is dry with wheat, wood leaves, mango, pine and minerals. Light maltiness in the background. Tadte is low bodied with low carbonation and a delicate smooth palate. Alot of fresh cut wood / birch leaves flavor. Also wheat, lemon,yeast, mango, minerals, some light iron and lemon pepper. Duration is average. Aftertaste is a bit oily but dry and slighly tart, and has lingering pine, fresh wood and grass, plus a low, balanced bitterness. Overall refreshing and well balanced with intersting character from the birch sap.

Piwo metne w kolorze slomkowym, cos jak kompot z gruszek czy jablek. Piana jasna drobnopecherzykowa dosc szybko znika. W aromacie czuc chyba ta brzoze, lekko miod i cytrusy. Nie jest zbyt intensywnie. W smaku polslodkie z lekka kwaskowa kontra, goryczki brak. Piwo lekkie i dosc pijalne chociaz niezbyt duzo sie dzieje.

Cloudy yellow body with a minimal white head. Light citrus and honey on the nose, and birch sap I guess, if you want it to be there. The aroma is quite weak. Fresh citrusy-sour wheat taste upfront, with a delicious birch juice aftertaste. Medium body with a creamy texture and fizzy carbonation. Yum!

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 Aroma of birch sap, some Centennial and hint of honey behind. Light body, refreshing taste of wheat and birch. Medium body. Dense but low foam, misty gold colour. Low bitterness, could be more intensive. It?s a good beer for refreshing in hot, sunny days.

Bottle from Elysium. Aroma: Fresh and crisp aroma of citrus (lemon, grapefruit) and birch sap. Appearance: Nice head, golden body. Taste: Light, fruity, lot of birch sap, very refreshing and tasty. Palate: Body is low, finish is semi-sweet, carbonation medium.

Draught @ Viva la PINTA, KrakÃ³w. Pours hazy pale straw with small white head. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with citric and hoppy notes. Mild, citric flavour with notes of malt and yeast and hops. Acidic aftertaste with estery hints. Decent.

Bottle. Medium, white, but unstable head. The aroma is sweet, with characteristic notes of juice from birch. The flavour is also sweet, the body is very smooth, without any bitterness.
Almost undrinkable, birch juice is tasteless for me, or even worse. Will never try again.

500ml bottle. Minimally milky, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Piney and citrusy hoppy aroma, some woody notes, hints of lemon, lemon zest, lemon drop, a touch of elderberry and honey. Taste is tart-ish, dry, woody, somehow tart-resinous, subtly sweet, a mixture of lemon, elderberry and honey that must stem from the birch sap. Smooth, soft and minimally sticky palate, gentle carbonation. Definitely a new taste experience for me - and beyond that a very tasty one indeed.
Really light, witbier-style appearance with a good, creamy head. Aroma is woody, mineral, and hay. Nice sparkly texture with a nice mixture of fresh lemons and earthy grass notes.

Really pale, hazy color with white head. Aroma is kind of weird with wet, musty hay, wet wood and also slightly mineral. Taste starts slightly sweet and lemony with the same musty/wet notes from the aroma. This definitely comes from the added birch sap. Soft, medium body with good carbonation. Overall I have mixed feelings about this one. ItÂ’s easy to drink and has some nice notes but that musty birch sap flavor might not be appealing to everyone.

50 cl bottle. slightly hazy, golden/straw colour with riche whitehead and decent lacing. aroma of lemon, hay and lemongrass. extremely refreshing and drinkable with fine crispiness.

16th March 2016Hazy pale gold beer, thin white head. Palate is light, dry and has a fair amount of fine minerally crispness. Thin malts. Tangy lemon citrus, but floral and a little piney. Kinda lemon grass but less lemon and more grass! Whisper of lime. A cooling floral finish, not minty but of that ilk. Interesting beer and pretty drinkable.

Aroma is pleasant if mild, wheat, citruses and slight grassiness. Pours milky straw colored, with big, snowy head. First sip feels flavorless and watery, but itÂ’s only the first one. Next one reveals light wheaty flavor, with touch of the birch sap and decent lot of citrusy/grassy hops, with very minor bitterness. Tilted towards sour, but slightly sweetened by honey. It has kind of a wheaty/bready aftertaste. All the flavors mingle wonderfully, and itÂ’s a very enjoyable beer. DoesnÂ’t feel watery at all (aside from the first sip), itÂ’s fairly oily and rather highly carbonated. Tasty and refreshing.

Many thanks for this beer to Grzesiek79. Pours a cloudy golden color. Wheat, yeast, clove and citrus aroma.

On tap at na 7.schode, Zilina. Pours is cloudy pale with thick white head. Aroma of citruses, orange peel, tangerine, light wheat. Taste is light sweet, some acidic notes, citrusy fresh mouthfeel. Medium body, sticky texture. Very fresh.

(Bottle 0.5l) Pale yellow, hazy colour. Big, white, medium fast falling head. Good lacing. Light body, watery texture, medium carbonation. Aroma: Wheat, floral hops, slightly grainy, soft birch sap. Taste: Soft sweet, strong birch sap, a bit watery, medium wheat, soft herbal bitterness. A bit bitter, short finish. Very crisp, high drinkability.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2015 Aroma: very floral, with citrus and wheat; not terribly intensive, though.Appearance: pale yellow, cloudy, with a largish, very stable head.Taste: moderately sour and mildly sweet (birch sap); a really nice balance.Palate: body medium, carbonation soft, finish mildly sweet and sour.Overall: very pleasant, very enjoyable. The balance is quite expert: sour just enough to be nicely refreshing, sweet just enough to not be too sour; intensive enough to not be blunt, mild enough to not be overwhelming. Very nice.

Quite refreshing and interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 This one was on tap so not much of the nuances have been recorded. If memory serves the beer was of unpeccable appearance. What I know for sure that the aroma was a very pleasant to the nose mixture of birch sap, apple and some citrus notes. Quite sweet in taste with yet another touch of birch and maybe a bit too withdrawn bitterness, the beer proved to be interesting and really tasty... much to my surprise in fact. Definitely worth a try.

wheaty aroma, birch sap, citruses; yellow, hazy, small white foam; medium- sweetness, light bitterness and sourness; light body, thin but not watery feel, lively carbonation, moderately long bittersweet finish;
Overall: extremely drinkable, refreshing, great taste, ok aroma, very nice

Bottle, bb 29.12.2015. Pours straw yellow, hazy, with nice white head. Aromas of lemon and wheat. Taste is a little bit sweet, light bitterness. Light bodied, very drinkable and refreshing.

Aroma of citrus (Centennial) and something sweet (birch sap I belive). Pours straw with nice white head. Taste is very refreshing, medium dry broken by a little bit of sweetness. Beer has medium body, bit oily texture and moderate carbonation, very drinkable. Good for summer.

Tap. Beautiful light yellow colour. Pretty head. Ultra citrusy in aroma, some wheat too. Citrus and a bit of interesting sweetness, not typical one, from the birch juice I presume. Little bitterness. Absolutely drinkable, quite thin though, but thatÂ’s to be expected. In highly recommend trying this beer.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 This beer had two faces. On BGM it was sweet, sweet, syrupy and with taste of grassy hops pellets. Tasted like hopped wort. Later it changed, to light wheat beer with sweet aroma (birch?). Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium bitter finish made it quite refreshing and light beer.

Draught in Piwna Stopa. Golden colour, hazy, nice and stable thick head with good lacing. Aroma of wheat, citrus with malty background. Taste is citrus and wheat, slightly sour. Leaves an oily mouthfeel similar to syrup/honey, bitterness is medium. Nicely refreshing, very drinkable beer .

Draught in Viva la Pinta. Amber colour, hazy, large thick head with very good lacing. Nose: aggressive spruce and raisin. Mouth: spruce, raisin, a bit of wheat, leaves a syrup-like taste in mouth, also similar to honey. Medium bitterness (definitely above average for a wheat beer), light sweetness. Light body. Ok.

On tap, pours golden, cloudy with stable white head. Malty, wheat aroma, some citrus and bit sulfur. Light bitterness, slightly sour, bit malt in taste. Light body, bit tart aftertaste.
Aroma of malt and american hops. Same in taste with nice sourness at the end. Bitterenes was balanced. Its very drinkable and light beer.

Aroma: citrus (fruity), wheat.
Appearance: nice hazy straw color, white head.
Taste: medium bitterness (grapefruit), some citrus notes, slightly sour (birch juice), wheat malt.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, nice bitter and sour finish, strange slimy texture.
Overall: Interesting combination, very drinkable and enjoying beer.
